what can you say about spirit warriors  
Is that a trick question? ;)  
no trick 🙂  
If they are useful in the meta (If the best decks use these cards), if they have been reprint or not, and their rarity (there is 2 secret rare cards per display = 24 booster packs )  
what does reprint mean (like fake?)  
That's an extension of ygo (= Yu-Gi-Oh) from 2017. Usually a new extension has about 200 cards, most of them are new  
Reprint means new impression of a card in a set, like you can get it either by opening one pack or an other ( from 2 different extension)

The second window is a python shell  
It means that it's an environment where the interpreter expects code in python  
Where the other one is just your regular shell

okay 🙂  
I also recommend StackOverflow If you have a random programmation question ;)

i search on the internet but i kinda have a problem that i don’t know what im searching for  
It happens a lot 😇  
Formulating your problem is like a very good step toward the solution  
Usually, If you can formulate it, it's quiet easy to find a solution  
It's like 1/4 of my job  
1. What is a module and why do i need to connect it? Why do i need to connect it in terminal and now just run the code ?  
So a module is a library  
It's a bit of code programmed by an other developer, that can be added to the base code  
You need to connect it in the python console (terminal), because it's your development environment  
And once it's added in it, it's there  
So then you can simply run your code, with the module included

A woman was shopping at her local supermarket, where she selected a quart of milk, a carton of eggs, juice, and a package of bacon.
As she was unloading her items on the conveyer belt to check out, a drunk standing behind her, watched as she placed her items in front of the cashier.
He said, "You must be single." The woman, a bit startled, looked at her four items on the belt, and seeing nothing particularly unusual about her selections said, "Well, y'know, that's right. But how in earth did you know that?

An autopsy professor was giving an introductory lecture to a class of students. Standing over a corpse, he addressed the class. "There are two things you need to make a career in medical forensics. First, you must have no fear." Having said that, he shoved his finger up the corpse's anus and licked it. "Now you must do the same," he told the class. After a couple of minutes of uneasy silence, the class did as instructed. "Second," the professor continued, "you must have an acute sense of observation. For instance, how many of you noticed that I put my middle finger up this man's anus, but licked my index finger?"

So First, you'll need what I said about your documents; and also, you'll need to get a Visa for a long stay  
Considering your situation, it should be ok; but passing a European/French certificate about French language &/or culture would be a great asset  
There is 2 main visa : visa for a year, that allows you to stay a year; and visa for stay, but with the staying part to ask for in France (i think you should try this one)  
And then, there are a lot of stuff to ask for and do in France  
In France, you'll need to sign a CIR (for Republican Integration Contract), where you'll say you'll abide by the laws and stuff; and they will "test" your willingness to integrate, to learn French, to know about French laws and principles, and to live well here; it's more a motivation test than a real knowledge test, but we will prepare for that)  
the minimum level in French to apply is A1  
So if you're A2, you're already good 🙂

Well, you have a lot of specialties in France : general doctor (that's a specialty ^^' ) , surgeon (you get specialised for a specific area of the body), psychiatrist, cancer, ...  
I don't understand  
you said Clara is a generalist  
So here it how it goes, since you want the full explanation :  
You have a first year of medical uni : at the end of it, you get an order : the best, and the worst...  
there is a "numerus closus", which is the number of "needed" doctors : like, on 2000, it's 300, something like that  
and then there is like 50 dentists places, 50 midwife, and 50 osteopaths  
then, for doctors :  
Youn get 5 more years of general studies, with a lot of time in the 5 and 6th year in the hospital; the goal is to learn about body, diseases, and to work in different fiels, to know what you like, what you don't, and what you're good at  
At the end for the 6th year ( first year, called PACES, + 5 years), you have a national order  
(competitive exam)  
And the 1 chooses his specialty, among a lot : surgeon (you need to choose like heart, hand, face, ...)  
psychiatrist, sport doctor, general doctor (like the regular one), ....  
Honey thank you , but I was just asking what Clara does as a generalist?  
You choose a specialty, and where to learn/work  
And then you have 4-6 more years; but you're already working, and called "doctor"  
She is in her 6 year, so this is the last one before she is a real doctor, in a specialty

Honey what is yu gi oh soul fusion?  
That's a weird question ^^'  
So, in yugioh, there are different "sets"  
Like a new set is released every 2 months or so  
Soul Fusion is the last one (but a new one arrives in like 2 weeks)  
In each set, there is a set of cards you can have from the packs you buy; around 250 cards per pack (most of them are new ones)  
And everyone mixes them?  
So usually I buy a box of packs when there are cards I'm interested in the set; I did it for 'soul fusion', but I actually didn't really enjoyed the cards, so I selled/traded my cards to other players  
Yes, you can mix all the sets in yugioh  
Even though usually new sets have more powerful cards  
Okay 😊  
And often, they released archetypes of cards in like a year or two; for example, if you want to play a specific strategy (like "Fur Hire", which is a pirate theme that I play), they released like 20 cards in one set, and then 2-3 months after an other 10 cards of this archetype in an other set; usually that during a year, and then new archetypes arrive)  
What is archetype ?  
Just in case you would want to gift me that yugioh cards, pleaes don't :p I have too many of them ^^' I have almost all the cards I want, I'm fine 🙂  
Okay honey ❤️  
An archetype is a strategy; in yugioh, they are around a name of card usually. all the cards (or most at least) have the same part of the name in name, and have effects that make combo between them, so work together.  
At the end is a list of almost all archetypes  
Which I call with you usually "strategy", because every archetype has usually a specific unique strategy  
It’s hard 😥  
It's hard to explain and understand like that; but if I show you the cards, it will make sense in 1min 🙂

this sounds even more complicating  
Family of foreign national residing in France  
The “family reunion” procedure, which allows you to join your family in France must be followed by your spouse or parent (if you are under 18 years of age) and be submitted to the Direction Territoriale de l’Office Français de l’Immigration et de l’Intégration (OFII ) in your place of residence. You must be able to prove that you have sufficient and regular resources in order to support your family as well as provide adequately-sized accommodation. The local Préfecture (i.e. in the place of residency) will determine whether these conditions have been met.

Once the application has been accepted by the police station, the consular services will contact you to issue your long-stay visa, which is valid for three months. You will then be issued with a residence permit which must be applied for at the police station in the département where you reside

département consulaire

In the French Consulate in Kiev, citizens of Ukraine and citizens permanently residing in Ukraine can apply for visas. The algorithm used for visa issuance looks like this:

First of all, the applicant must decide on the choice of the type of visa;
further - to collect the required documents;
call the Visa Office to determine the date of appearance at the consulate;
appear on the appointed day with the necessary documents.

In Ukraine with used to have non biomentrical passports where we put our tourist visa. Now we have biometrical passports that allow us to travel for 90 days with no visa to the EU. So now we can’t really make tourist visas in our biomentrical passport because the embassy might have a lot of questions plus in any case we can be only 90 days on the territory of the EU

That's weird to me  
We have a specific answer for that, when you ask a negative question, and the answer is the opposite (so negative of the negative = positive); in English, it's still yes (you're not hungry ? Yes, I am)  
In Russian, it's "нет"  
Misha is not a student ? No, he is.  
Is that okay on English ?  
Tu n'as pas faim? Si, j'ai faim (here "si" means opposite of opposite)  
You’re not hungry ? Si im hungry

Туда - is the answer on the question куда? (its like "to where"). Я иду куда? Туда, в магазин. Where am I going? To the shop.
Там - is the answer on the question где? (again, "where"?) Где ты купил это? Там, в магазине. Where did you buy this? Over there, in a shop. 
I hope it got more clear)

What's the difference between знает и умеет?  
Знать = know
Уметь = can

I know how to swim - Я знаю, как плавать.
I can swim - Я умею плавать.

==> imparfait  
"J'ai habité à Lyon pendant 22 ans (mais maintenant j'habite à Paris)"  
Something in the past, lasting (emphasis on the time span), with a link to the present / the current conversation  
I lived in Lyon last year  
So this can be translated as I have lived in Lyon for 22 years  
so It’s visa verca  
I've lived in Lyon for 22 years  
It's exactly the same as in English  
I thought it’s the other way around 🙂  
No, it's not ^^'

The French imperfect (imparfait) is a descriptive past tense which indicates an ongoing state of being or a repeated or incomplete action. The beginning and end of the state of being or action are not indicated
